title: Latitude feedback at bottom half of price range: book message
text:
Latitude Financial Group's brokers have ended the week with a book message to potential investors, talking up demand for the year's biggest initial public offering.

"As at 3pm today, early indications of demand from institutions and retail brokers has been received for approximately 70% of the offer size at the bottom end of the range," the message sent to potential investors said.

"The Australian leg of the management roadshow has concluded with strong institutional engagement with valuation feedback currently focused on the bottom half of the 12.4 – 13.9x PE price range.

"The global roadshow commenced today in New Zealand (including presentations to retail brokers), with management seeing institutions through Asia, Europe and North America next week ahead of the institutional bookbuild on 15 – 16 October."

Latitude is seeking to raise $1.24 billion to $1.4 billion at $2 to $2.25 a share for what would be the year's biggest ASX-listing.

The book message came as Latitude's six-strong retail broker syndicate started taking client bids for the broker firm offer.
description: Latitude Financial Group's brokers have ended the week with a book message to potential investors, talking up demand for the year's biggest initial public offering.
